topic.title: Interlaken Provisioning and De-provisioning

section.title: Interlaken Channel Datapath Segment Provisioning
section.p: Interlaken interface channel datapath segment provisioning is performed by initializing the flow control calendars with the g5_api_ilkn_fc_set() API and provisioning the channel with either the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API or g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API.

The g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API provisions the COPI subsystem and the Interlaken Interface's channel for packet terminated datapath segments. Figure 1 shows the datapath segment from the DCPB(A) through the COPI Subsystem to the Interlaken interface(B).

fig.title: Interlaken Datapath Segment Provisioning: DCPB to Interlaken Interface

section.p: The g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API provisions the SAR block, DCPB block, COPI subsystem and the Interlaken Interface's channel for CBR datapath segments. Figure 2 shows the datapath segment provisioning from the OCPB block(A) of the COREOTN through the SAR block, then through the DCPB block and through the COPI subsystem to the Interlaken interface(B).

fig.title: Interlaken Datapath Segment Provisioning: OCPB to Interlaken Interface

section.p: In N x 200G Interlaken interface mode three additional API are required to select which one of the up to three Interlaken interfaces the channel data is sent to the DCPB block. The API are as follows:

li.p: g5_api_ilkn_chnl_id_bcw_set() - used in N x 200G Interlaken mode to set the Fabric Egress BCW channel ID for a common DPI channel to the DCPB.
g5_api_ilkn_fabric_egress_select() - selects which fabric egress N x Interlaken interface channel to transfer data to DCPB.
g5_api_ilkn_fabric_ingress_chnl_activate() - selects an Interlaken interface that the provisioned channel id is to transfer DCPB data to.

section.title: Interlaken Channel Datapath Segment Provisioning API Details
section.p: The g5_api_ilkn_fc_set() API takes in the Interlaken Flow Control Calendar and stores it to be applied later when Interlaken channels get provisioned by the g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API or g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API. This API is used to configure the user defined Flow Control calendar for a 1 x Fabric Ingress interface and up to 3 instances of Fabric Egress interfaces per device. The API parameters are shown below with any associated arrays.
The device_id parameter is the device instance.

The ilkn_intf parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_fc_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_intf_t and is the Interlaken interface instance that the flow control calendar applies to. The enumerator values are shown in the table below.

entry.p: No Interlaken interface is to be used.

section.p: The *tx_fc_cal parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_fc_set() API is an input array of 300 UINT32 flow control entries for Fabric ingress. This can be set to NULL if this API is used to set the Rx flow control calendar only.

The *rx_fc_cal parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_fc_set() API is an input array of 300 UINT32 flow control entries for Fabric egress. This can be set to NULL if this API is used to set the Tx flow control calendar only.

Both *tx_fc_cal and *rx_fc_cal use the g5_ilkn_fc_cal_t Struct Reference to define the Interlaken flow control calendar. Each calendar can contain up to 300 entries (defined by fc_cal_length). Each entry corresponds to a flow control bit that is passed in-band on the Interlaken interface.
Each flow control entry can be one of following for BCW Channel ID data:

li.p: G5_ILKN_LINK_FLOW_CONTROL – calendar entry is passing flow control for the link channel number – calendar entry is passing flow control for a specific BCW channel ID (from 0 to 255).

section.p: Each flow control entry can be one of following for 2B header data:

li.p: G5_ILKN_LINK_FLOW_CONTROL_2B – calendar entry is passing flow control for the link channel number – calendar entry is passing flow control for a specific 2 byte header (from 0 to 0xFFFF).

section.p: The channel number is represented through the 2B header by method of CAM search if Interlaken configuration has: 'rx_header_mode' set to G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_2B_CAM or G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_2B_CAM_AND_4B, 'tx_header_mode' set to G5_ILKN_TX_ILKN_HEADER_2B or G5_ILKN_TX_HEADER_2B_AND_4B. Otherwise channel number is represented as BCW channel ID.

Channels can represent arbitrary bandwidth from 1.25G to 500G. The speed of flow control response (i.e reacting to either XOFF or XON) is controlled by how the calendar entries are populated. Specifically, how many calendar entries have the same channel number and the distribution of these entries over the complete calendar. For example, if you were using in-band flow control with 16 flow control bits per ICW/BCW and 300 calendar entries (which requires 18 ICW/BCW to transfer) shown in the table below.

table.title: Interlaken Inband Flow Control Calendar Example

entry.p: use 1 entry every ICW/BCW (consumes all the bandwidth)
use 1 entry every 3 ICW/BCW (consumes 1/3 of the bandwidth)
use 1 entry every 12 ICW/BCW (consumes 1/12 of the bandwidth)
use 1 entry every 18 ICW/BCW (consumes 1/96 of the bandwidth)

section.p: The g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API provisions a packetized Interlaken segment. The function configures the Interlaken channel and provisions the Interlaken channel across the DCPB. After this function is called, the datapath is provisioned but not activated at the DCPB.The API parameters are shown below with any associated enumerated types.
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the user specified channel ID for the datapath channel.

The fabric_ingress_rate parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API provides the information for clients passing through DCPB and is defined by the enumeration g5_fabric_ingress_rate_t. The rate enumerators are shown in Table 3 below.

entry.p: ODU2, ENET 10GE traffic, or FlexE 10GE client.
ODUFlex traffic; number of ODU0 needs to be specified along with this.
FlexE client in 25G increment. Range 25G to 500G (ILKN max bandwidth) number of 25G increments needs to be specified along with this.

section.p: The fabric_ingress_client_num_incr parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API is used for the packet data channel rate. If the parameter fabric_ingress_rate == G5_FABRIC_INGRESS_RATE_NXODU0_GFP_FLEX then the recommended values are in Table 4 below. For ODUflex(GFP), use the following formula to calculate the fabric_ingress_client_num_incr parameter:
fabric_ingress_client_num_incr >= (signal_rate Gbps)/(ODUk.ts_bit_rate Gbps), where ODUk.ts bit rates are:

table.title: NxODU0 Values for ODUk Rate for fabric_ingress_client_num_incr

section.p: If the parameter fabric_ingress_rate == G5_FABRIC_INGRESS_RATE_NX25G_FLEXE_CLIENT then parameter fabric_ingress_client_num_incr is the number of 25G bit rate increments. The fabric_ingress_client_num_incr parameter is not used if the parameter fabric_ingress_rate of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API does not equal G5_FABRIC_INGRESS_RATE_NXODU0_GFP_FLEX or G5_FABRIC_INGRESS_RATE_NX25G_FLEXE_CLIENT.

The fabric_ingress_halt_buffer parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API is the CPB FIFO buffer room to capture in flight data in the event that CPB FIFO is backpressured from down stream subsystem. For example Interlaken backpressures CPB due to channel XOFF being detected. fabric_ingress_halt_buffer is specified in units of blocks.
The fabric_ingress_bcw_chnl parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API is the ingress Interlaken channel ID in the BCW header.

The fabric_egress_halt_buffer parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API is the CPB FIFO buffer room to capture in flight data in the event that CPB FIFO is backpressured from down stream subsystem. For example Interlaken backpressures CPB due to channel XOFF being detected. fabric_egress_halt_buffer is specified in units of blocks.
The fabric_egress_bcw_chnl parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API is the egress Interlaken channel ID in the BCW header.

The header_mode parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_pkt_prov() API is defined by the g5_ilkn_pkt_header_t enumeration that specifies the Interlaken Interface packet traffic header presence. A four byte header may be used to provide small packet throughput performance or to transfer data to be set in the Tx GFP UPI TYPE field. The header is ignored for Ethernet interface applications, but is supported to allow header presence consistency or non-consistency as required by the connected Interlaken fabric device. The enumerator choices are G5_ILKN_PKT_HEADER_NONE, where no optional header is present, or G5_ILKN_PKT_HEADER_4B where the optional 4 byte header is present.

The g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API provisions a CBR Interlaken segment. After this function is called, the datapath is provisioned but not connected across the OCPB and requires a call to the g5_api_switch_connect() API. This API can be used in an additive manner where the Interlaken channel is set up only in the fabric ingress direction or only in the fabric egress direction or both. To perform Tx Interlaken channel provisioning independently of Rx Interlaken channel provisioning:

li.p: If provisioning Tx before Rx: Provision Tx Interlaken only by providing 'fabric_ingress_data' struct of 'g5_traffic_ilkn_cbr_t' struct.

ul.li: If provisioning Rx before Tx: Provision Rx Interlaken only by providing 'fabric_egress_data' struct of 'g5_traffic_ilkn_cbr_t' struct

li.p: If provisioning Rx and Tx at the same time: Provision Tx and Rx paths both by providing 'fabric_ingress_data' and 'fabric_egress_data' of 'g5_traffic_ilkn_cbr_t' struct.

section.p: The g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API parameters are shown below with any associated structures.
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the user specified Interlaken channel ID for the datapath channel.

The info parameter is defined by the structure g5_traffic_ilkn_cbr_t that has two members fabric_ingress_data and fabric_egress_data. These are defined by two additional structures, g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_ingress_t and g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_egress_t, respectively.
The structure g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_ingress_t has the following members and associated structures:
The member rate_info has the following structure g5_ilkn_cbr_rate_t has the following members and associated enumerations.
The member rate has the following enumeration g5_oduk_t that has the enumerators shown in Table 5 below.

entry.p: ODUFlex-CBR, ODUFlex-IMP, ODUFlex-FlexE Aware, PRBS, NULL

section.p: The member client_bitrate of the structure g5_ilkn_cbr_rate_t is only used if ilkn_cbr_rate_t == G5_ODUK_ODUFLEX_CBR where the client bitrate defines the size of the overall CBR rate and is used to calculate the number of ODUflex timeslots required.
The member client_num_incr of the structure g5_ilkn_cbr_rate_t is required as follows:

li.p: if ilkn_cbr_rate_t == G5_ODUK_ODUFLEX_GFP which applies to ITU-T G.709 Table 7-8 where the GFP-F client rate is specified in 1G25 increments.
if ilkn_cbr_rate_t == G5_ODUK_ODUFLEX_IMP where the IMP client rate is specified in 5G increments and calculated as: s x 239/238 x 5,156,250 kbits/s where s = 2,8, n x 5 with n > 0
If G5_ODUK_ODUFLEX_X_GE_BMP: 25/50/200/400GE BMP mapped client, client rate is specified in 5G increments.
G5_ODUK_ODUFLEX_FLEXE_AWARE - Number of available 5G timeslots in the FlexE payload.

section.p: The member pkt_data of the structure g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_ingress_t is defined by the structure g5_opsa_pkt_data_t that has two members, pkt_size and calc_type. pkt_size is defined by the enumeration g5_opsa_traffic_class_t that has the packet fabric class options as defined in the OIF OTN Over Packet Fabric Protocol (OFP) implementation Agreement (IA) recommendation. These are shown in Table 6 below. calc_type specifies the calculator type used to determine the values of B, T and Tfrac needed for the OCPB. calc_type is defined by the enumeration g5_pkt_calc_t and has the values shown in Table 7 below.

entry.p: Indicates that no FEC is to be applied
Used to interconnect with the HyPHY20G device

section.p: The member halt_buffer of the structure g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_ingress_t specifies the OCPB FIFO buffer room required to capture in flight data in the event that OCPB FIFO generates an upstream flow control signal. halt_buffer is specified in units of blocks. The block size in bytes per unit is: 768 bytes.
The member ilkn_header of the structure g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_ingress_t specifies is defined by the structure g5_ilkn_header_t. g5_ilkn_header_t has three members as follows:

The member ilkn_bcw_chnl of the structure g5_ilkn_header_t specifies the Interlaken channel in the BCW header. In N x 200G Interlaken mode, when used in the Fabric egress, this member is used for the BCW channel ID on Interlaken Interface #0. In order to set a BCW channel ID from Interlaken Interface #1 and #2 the g5_api_ilkn_chnl_id_bcw_set() API must be called. This API is described below.

The member ilkn_2b_header of the structure g5_ilkn_header_t specifies the 2 byte header value. The member ilkn_4b_header of the structure g5_ilkn_header_t specifies the 4 byte header value. If no 2 byte or 4 byte header is to be inserted set the value to G5_MAX_INT.
The structure g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_egress_t of the info parameter of the g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API has the following members and associated structures:

The members rate_info, pkt_data, halt_buffer and ilkn_header have been discussed above. The member opsa_fifo of the structure g5_ilkn_cbr_fabric_ingress_t is defined by the structure opsa_fifo_t that has two members latency_s and hys_buffer. latency_s specifies the maximum system latency outside the device, typically the system latency across a packet fabric. latency_s is specified in units of 3.125 nanosecond ticks. The maximum supported value is 38880 representing a maximum system latency of 125 microseconds. hys_buffer represents the size of the hysteresis buffer in reference clock cycles. If hys_buffer is set to 0, the default value of 5us is used. For more info on latency_s and hys_buffer see section .....
As stated above there are three additional APIs required for N x 200G Interlaken interface mode.

The first API g5_api_ilkn_chnl_id_bcw_set(), is used in N x 200G Interlaken mode to set the Fabric Egress BCW channel ID for a common DPI channel to the DCPB. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the user specified Interlaken channel ID for the datapath channel. The info ilkn_intf is defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_intf_t that is shown in Table 1 above. The parameter ilkn_bcw_chnl is a Fabric egress BCW channel ID for the DPI channel specified by the parameter chnl_id.
The second API g5_api_ilkn_fabric_egress_select(), selects which fabric egress N x Interlaken interface channel to transfer to DCPB. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the user specified Interlaken channel ID for the datapath channel. The info ilkn_intf is defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_intf_t that is shown in Table 1 above.

The third API g5_api_ilkn_fabric_ingress_chnl_activate(), selects an Interlaken interface that the provisioned channel id is to transfer DCPB data to. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the user specified Interlaken channel ID for the datapath channel. The info ilkn_intf is defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_intf_t that is shown in Table 1 above. The parameter activate is defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_ingress_activate_t has has the enumerators G5_ILKN_INGRESS_ACTIVATE_ENABLE and G5_ILKN_INGRESS_ACTIVATE_DISABLE that enable or disable the ingress data towards the interface specified with ilkn_intf.
